question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: intern_deferred()] [Clone panic] If Clone::clone() panics at line 148, is the interner left in a consistent state, or can this poison locks or corrupt internal state, requiring validator restart? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: alloc()] [OOM handling] If Vec::with_capacity fails to allocate memory at line 84, can the resulting panic be caught and handled gracefully, or does it crash the validator process unrecoverably? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: intern_deferred()] [Lock poisoning] If any operation panics while holding the write lock, does parking_lot's RwLock poison the lock, and can this cause all subsequent intern operations to fail, effectively disabling Move VM functionality? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: flush()] [Clear panic] Can any of the clear() operations on map, vec, buffer, or pool panic? If so, can partial clearing leave the interner in an unusable state that breaks subsequent transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: intern_deferred()] [ABA problem] Between releasing the read lock and acquiring the write lock, can the same value be interned, removed (via flush), and interned again with a different index, causing the second check to find the 'wrong' cached index? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: len()] [Snapshot inconsistency] If len() is called during concurrent intern operations, can it return a length that was never actually consistent with the true state, causing bounds checks to fail incorrectly? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: lookup()] [Phantom read] Can lookup() return an index for a value that was just flushed by another thread, causing the caller to use an invalid index that crashes when dereferenced? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: is_empty()] [Empty-nonempty race] Can is_empty() return true while another thread is simultaneously interning a value, and if so, can this cause incorrect optimization decisions in calling code? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: intern_deferred()] [Write lock starvation] Can continuous read operations prevent write operations from ever acquiring the lock, effectively preventing new values from being interned and blocking Move module loading? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: alloc()] [next_size overflow] Starting at 2048 and doubling each time, next_size reaches usize::MAX after about 50-60 doublings - can this overflow be triggered on long-running validators, and would the overflow cause memory corruption or panic? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: intern_deferred()] [Index wraparound] If vec.len() - 1 is calculated when vec is empty (len=0), does this wrap around to usize::MAX, and could this be exploited to corrupt memory through out-of-bounds access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: intern_deferred()] [Vec capacity overflow] Can Vec::push at line 159 panic if vec has somehow reached its maximum capacity, and would this panic leave map and vec inconsistent? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Constant: INITIAL_SIZE] [Capacity calculation] When multiplying capacities, can intermediate calculations overflow, causing Vec::with_capacity to allocate less memory than expected and triggering unexpected reallocations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/interner.rs] [Function: len()] [Length overflow] Can the vec length theoretically exceed usize::MAX on 32-bit systems, causing len() to return incorrect values and breaking index calculations? (Low)
